articles.title: Tanjong Pagar crash: Families of three passengers seek S$1.7 million from estate of driver - The Star Online
articles.description: SINGAPORE (The Straits Times/Asia News Network): The families of three men killed in a fiery crash in Tanjong Pagar in 2021, are seeking to claim about S$1.7 million from the estate of the last person behind the wheel.

articles.title: Are COVID-19 vaccines safe for kids? Experts answer common questions from sceptical parents - Channel NewsAsia
articles.description: A local survey showed that fathers are more vaccine hesitant than mothers when it comes to COVID-19 jabs for their children. And does social media influence parents' decisions? Find out what the common concerns are and what paediatricians say.

articles.title: Jesseca Liu endured months of husband Jeremy Chan acting like a child at home for ghost drama Soul Detective - Channel NewsAsia
articles.description: In the supernatural drama series, which also stars Bryan Wong, Phyllis Quek and Priscelia Chan, Liu’s hubby stayed in character as a childlike spirit – and the rest of the cast even started talking like him. “It was so annoying,” quipped the actress.
articles.content:
He also revealed that he found it easier to stay in character throughout the filming process even at home with his wife.
This, as you can imagine, did not go down so well with Liu.
